intro: Porroglossum dejonghei, commonly known as the Desert Ghost, is a flowering plant native to the arid regions of southern Africa. It is a member of the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads that resemble daisies. The plant has a low, sprawling growth habit with silver-gray foliage that helps it conserve water in its harsh environment. Its flowers are typically yellow or orange, blooming during the rainy season to attract pollinators. Porroglossum dejonghei is adapted to extreme drought conditions, making it a resilient and hardy species.
